TEXT.English: Dawn of Civilization features a completely new tech tree, consisting of 141 technologies spread over 7 eras.
TEXT.French: Dawn of Civilization possède un tout nouvel arbre technologique fait de 141 technologies réparties sur 7 ères.
TEXT.German: Dawn of Civilization features a completely new tech tree, consisting of 141 technologies spread over 7 eras.
TEXT.Italian: Dawn of Civilization features a completely new tech tree, consisting of 141 technologies spread over 7 eras.
TEXT.Spanish: Dawn of Civilization features a completely new tech tree, consisting of 141 technologies spread over 7 eras.

TEXT.English: The last two eras are now called the Global and Digital eras.
TEXT.French: Les deux dernières ères s'appellent désormais l'ère mondiale et l'ère numérique.
TEXT.German: The last two eras are now called the Global and Digital eras.
TEXT.Italian: The last two eras are now called the Global and Digital eras.
TEXT.Spanish: The last two eras are now called the Global and Digital eras.

TEXT.English: Siege units are now much more expensive, but their increased withdrawal chance also makes them less expendable.
TEXT.French: Les unités de siège sont désormais plus coûteuses, mais leur chance élevée de battre en retraite les rend plus durables.
TEXT.German: Siege units are now much more expensive, but their increased withdrawal chance also makes them less expendable.
TEXT.Italian: Siege units are now much more expensive, but their increased withdrawal chance also makes them less expendable.
TEXT.Spanish: Siege units are now much more expensive, but their increased withdrawal chance also makes them less expendable.

TEXT.English: Instead of starting with no religion, each civilisation starts with its own specific pagan religion. These religions do not have any of the benefits of major religions, however.
TEXT.French: Au lieu de commencer la partie sans religion, chaque civilisation naît avec sa propre religion païenne. Ces religions n'ont toutefois aucun des avantages des religions majeures.
TEXT.German: Instead of starting with no religion, each civilisation starts with its own specific pagan religion. These religions do not have any of the benefits of major religions, however.
TEXT.Italian: Instead of starting with no religion, each civilisation starts with its own specific pagan religion. These religions do not have any of the benefits of major religions, however.
TEXT.Spanish: Instead of starting with no religion, each civilisation starts with its own specific pagan religion. These religions do not have any of the benefits of major religions, however.

TEXT.English: The presence of non-state religions causes unhappiness in your cities, unless you adopt the Tolerance civic.
TEXT.French: La présence de religions non officielles cause du malheur dans vos villes, à moins que vous n'adoptiez la doctrine de la tolérance.
TEXT.German: The presence of non-state religions causes unhappiness in your cities, unless you adopt the Tolerance civic.
TEXT.Italian: The presence of non-state religions causes unhappiness in your cities, unless you adopt the Tolerance civic.
TEXT.Spanish: The presence of non-state religions causes unhappiness in your cities, unless you adopt the Tolerance civic.

TEXT.English: Units lose all their promotions when upgraded. A portion of the experience earned is refunded, depending on the strength difference between the previous and current unit type.
TEXT.French: Les unités perdent toutes leurs promotions lorsqu'elles sont améliorées. Une partie de leur expérience leur est alors remboursée selon la différence de puissance entre les deux types d'unités.
TEXT.German: Units lose all their promotions when upgraded. A portion of the experience earned is refunded, depending on the strength difference between the previous and current unit type.
TEXT.Italian: Units lose all their promotions when upgraded. A portion of the experience earned is refunded, depending on the strength difference between the previous and current unit type.
TEXT.Spanish: Units lose all their promotions when upgraded. A portion of the experience earned is refunded, depending on the strength difference between the previous and current unit type.

TEXT.English: City defense now also protects against collateral damage: unit strength can never be reduced below the current defense modifier.
TEXT.French: La défense des villes protège maintenant contre les dommages collatéraux : la santé des unités ne peut jamais être diminuée par les dommages collatéraux au-delà du modificateur de défense actuel.
TEXT.German: City defense now also protects against collateral damage: unit strength can never be reduced below the current defense modifier.
TEXT.Italian: City defense now also protects against collateral damage: unit strength can never be reduced below the current defense modifier.
TEXT.Spanish: City defense now also protects against collateral damage: unit strength can never be reduced below the current defense modifier.

TEXT.English: Entering enemy waters consumes all remaining movement points.
TEXT.French: Entrer dans les eaux territoriales de l'ennemi utilise tous les points de mouvements restants.
TEXT.German: Entering enemy waters consumes all remaining movement points.
TEXT.Italian: Entering enemy waters consumes all remaining movement points.
TEXT.Spanish: Entering enemy waters consumes all remaining movement points.

TEXT.English: Bad health from power is multiplied by the number of buildings that consume power.
TEXT.French: La maladie créée par la production d'électricité est multipliée par le nombre de bâtiments qui consomment de l'électricité.
TEXT.German: Bad health from power is multiplied by the number of buildings that consume power.
TEXT.Italian: Bad health from power is multiplied by the number of buildings that consume power.
TEXT.Spanish: Bad health from power is multiplied by the number of buildings that consume power.

TEXT.English: When running Slavery, defeated enemy units can be captured as Workers. If they are Native or the winning unit is Aztec they get captured as slaves instead.
TEXT.French: When running Slavery, defeated enemy units can be captured as Workers. If they are Native or the winning unit is Aztec they get captured as slaves instead.
TEXT.German: When running Slavery, defeated enemy units can be captured as Workers. If they are Native or the winning unit is Aztec they get captured as slaves instead.
TEXT.Italian: When running Slavery, defeated enemy units can be captured as Workers. If they are Native or the winning unit is Aztec they get captured as slaves instead.
TEXT.Spanish: When running Slavery, defeated enemy units can be captured as Workers. If they are Native or the winning unit is Aztec they get captured as slaves instead.

TEXT.English: The number of National Wonders and Great Wonders that can be built in a city is limited by its culture level.
TEXT.French: Le nombre de merveilles nationales et de merveilles du monde pouvant être construites dans une ville est limité par son niveau culturel.
TEXT.German: The number of National Wonders and Great Wonders that can be built in a city is limited by its culture level.
TEXT.Italian: The number of National Wonders and Great Wonders that can be built in a city is limited by its culture level.
TEXT.Spanish: The number of National Wonders and Great Wonders that can be built in a city is limited by its culture level.

TEXT.English: Many classical wonders can only be built with no state religion in cities without any religions.
TEXT.French: De nombreuses merveilles de l'ère classique ne peuvent être constuites que par des civilisations sans religion d'État, et dans des villes sans religions.
TEXT.German: Many classical wonders can only be built with no state religion in cities without any religions.
TEXT.Italian: Many classical wonders can only be built with no state religion in cities without any religions.
TEXT.Spanish: Many classical wonders can only be built with no state religion in cities without any religions.

TEXT.English: Mounted units have been split into Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry.
TEXT.French: Les unités montées ont été divisées en deux catégories : cavalerie légère et cavalerie lourde.
TEXT.German: Mounted units have been split into Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry.
TEXT.Italian: Mounted units have been split into Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry.
TEXT.Spanish: Mounted units have been split into Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry.

TEXT.English: Some units are stronger in open terrain. Tiles that are flat, have no features with defensive bonuses, and do not contain a city or fort count as open terrain.
TEXT.French: Certaines unités sont plus puissantes en terrain dégagé. Pour compter comme un terrain dégagé, une case doit être plate, ne pas posséder de caractéristique avec un bonus de défense, et ne pas contenir de ville ou de fort.
TEXT.German: Some units are stronger in open terrain. Tiles that are flat, have no features with defensive bonuses, and do not contain a city or fort count as open terrain.
TEXT.Italian: Some units are stronger in open terrain. Tiles that are flat, have no features with defensive bonuses, and do not contain a city or fort count as open terrain.
TEXT.Spanish: Some units are stronger in open terrain. Tiles that are flat, have no features with defensive bonuses, and do not contain a city or fort count as open terrain.

TEXT.English: In addition to discovering the associated technology, to found a religion you also need to control a city in its historical core region.
TEXT.French: Pour fonder une religion, vous devez non seulement découvrir la technologie appropriée, mais aussi contrôler une ville dans le cœur historique de la religion.
TEXT.German: In addition to discovering the associated technology, to found a religion you also need to control a city in its historical core region.
TEXT.Italian: In addition to discovering the associated technology, to found a religion you also need to control a city in its historical core region.
TEXT.Spanish: In addition to discovering the associated technology, to found a religion you also need to control a city in its historical core region.

TEXT.English: Resources now only supply a limited number of cities with happiness or health. Acquire additional instances of a resource to keep your growing empire supplied!
TEXT.French: Les ressources fournissent de la santé et du bonheur à un nombre désormais limité de villes. Obtenez davantage de copies d'une ressource pour approvisionner votre empire en expansion !
TEXT.German: Resources now only supply a limited number of cities with happiness or health. Acquire additional instances of a resource to keep your growing empire supplied!
TEXT.Italian: Resources now only supply a limited number of cities with happiness or health. Acquire additional instances of a resource to keep your growing empire supplied!
TEXT.Spanish: Resources now only supply a limited number of cities with happiness or health. Acquire additional instances of a resource to keep your growing empire supplied!

TEXT.English: The late game has been expanded: the last technologies in the tech tree are more expensive to research, but also provide more content in the form of additional buildings and projects as well as the ability to build satellites.
TEXT.French: The late game has been expanded: the last technologies in the tech tree are more expensive to research, but also provide more content in the form of additional buildings and projects as well as the ability to build satellites.
TEXT.German: The late game has been expanded: the last technologies in the tech tree are more expensive to research, but also provide more content in the form of additional buildings and projects as well as the ability to build satellites.
TEXT.Italian: The late game has been expanded: the last technologies in the tech tree are more expensive to research, but also provide more content in the form of additional buildings and projects as well as the ability to build satellites.
TEXT.Spanish: The late game has been expanded: the last technologies in the tech tree are more expensive to research, but also provide more content in the form of additional buildings and projects as well as the ability to build satellites.

TEXT.English: To win the Space Victory, you now have to construct a permanent base on Mars, instead of sending a colony ship to Alpha Centauri
TEXT.French: To win the Space Victory, you now have to construct a permanent base on Mars, instead of sending a colony ship to Alpha Centauri
TEXT.German: To win the Space Victory, you now have to construct a permanent base on Mars, instead of sending a colony ship to Alpha Centauri
TEXT.Italian: To win the Space Victory, you now have to construct a permanent base on Mars, instead of sending a colony ship to Alpha Centauri
TEXT.Spanish: To win the Space Victory, you now have to construct a permanent base on Mars, instead of sending a colony ship to Alpha Centauri

TEXT.English: The space race has become a lot more detailed: many projects are required to enable the Space Victory, each giving additional benefits to the first civilisation to complete them. Several projects unrelated to the Space Victory also synergise with investing in space production.
TEXT.French: The space race has become a lot more detailed: many projects are required to enable the Space Victory, each giving additional benefits to the first civilisation to complete them. Several projects unrelated to the Space Victory also synergise with investing in space production.
TEXT.German: The space race has become a lot more detailed: many projects are required to enable the Space Victory, each giving additional benefits to the first civilisation to complete them. Several projects unrelated to the Space Victory also synergise with investing in space production.
TEXT.Italian: The space race has become a lot more detailed: many projects are required to enable the Space Victory, each giving additional benefits to the first civilisation to complete them. Several projects unrelated to the Space Victory also synergise with investing in space production.
TEXT.Spanish: The space race has become a lot more detailed: many projects are required to enable the Space Victory, each giving additional benefits to the first civilisation to complete them. Several projects unrelated to the Space Victory also synergise with investing in space production.

TEXT.English: Some major civilisations have a second unique unit.
TEXT.French: Some major civilisations have a second unique unit.
TEXT.German: Some major civilisations have a second unique unit.
TEXT.Italian: Some major civilisations have a second unique unit.
TEXT.Spanish: Some major civilisations have a second unique unit.

TEXT.English: When capturing a city, you now have the additional options to sack or spare it. More gold can be plundered in sacked cities, at the cost of more severe building damage and unrest. Sparing cities reduces unrest and building damage but instead costs money.
TEXT.French: When capturing a city, you now have the additional options to sack or spare it. More gold can be plundered in sacked cities, at the cost of more severe building damage and unrest. Sparing cities reduces unrest and building damage but instead costs money.
TEXT.German: When capturing a city, you now have the additional options to sack or spare it. More gold can be plundered in sacked cities, at the cost of more severe building damage and unrest. Sparing cities reduces unrest and building damage but instead costs money.
TEXT.Italian: When capturing a city, you now have the additional options to sack or spare it. More gold can be plundered in sacked cities, at the cost of more severe building damage and unrest. Sparing cities reduces unrest and building damage but instead costs money.
TEXT.Spanish: When capturing a city, you now have the additional options to sack or spare it. More gold can be plundered in sacked cities, at the cost of more severe building damage and unrest. Sparing cities reduces unrest and building damage but instead costs money.

TEXT.English: Cities no longer just lose one population when captured. Large cities can lose additional population, especially if you decide to sack them.
TEXT.French: Cities no longer just lose one population when captured. Large cities can lose additional population, especially if you decide to sack them.
TEXT.German: Cities no longer just lose one population when captured. Large cities can lose additional population, especially if you decide to sack them.
TEXT.Italian: Cities no longer just lose one population when captured. Large cities can lose additional population, especially if you decide to sack them.
TEXT.Spanish: Cities no longer just lose one population when captured. Large cities can lose additional population, especially if you decide to sack them.

TEXT.English: Cities cannot be instantly razed anymore. After ordering a city to be razed, it will lose population each turn while in unrest, and finally be destroyed when the population reaches zero.
TEXT.French: Cities cannot be instantly razed anymore. After ordering a city to be razed, it will lose population each turn while in unrest, and finally be destroyed when the population reaches zero.
TEXT.German: Cities cannot be instantly razed anymore. After ordering a city to be razed, it will lose population each turn while in unrest, and finally be destroyed when the population reaches zero.
TEXT.Italian: Cities cannot be instantly razed anymore. After ordering a city to be razed, it will lose population each turn while in unrest, and finally be destroyed when the population reaches zero.
TEXT.Spanish: Cities cannot be instantly razed anymore. After ordering a city to be razed, it will lose population each turn while in unrest, and finally be destroyed when the population reaches zero.

TEXT.English: You can use a settler to immediately construct buildings in a city. This will give all buildings that a new city would receive for free when founded.
